caption: Fra Angelico’s Annunciation (mid-1430s)
description: Fra Angelico's delicate Annunciation depicts the moment when Archangel Gabriel announces to Mary that she will bear the Son of God, set within Renaissance architecture.
subject: Biblical scene of Angel Gabriel announcing to Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: Rembrandt's The Visitation
description: Rembrandt's dramatic Visitation shows Mary and Elizabeth embracing, with deep chiaroscuro highlighting their spiritual connection and miraculous pregnancies.
subject: Mary visiting her cousin Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Giovanni Antonio Pellegrini's The Nativity
description: Pellegrini's Nativity depicts the newborn Christ surrounded by Mary, Joseph, and adoring angels in a softly lit stable setting.
subject: Birth of Jesus Christ in Bethlehem
title: The Nativity

caption: Fresco of Presentation in the Temple in Chiesa di Santa Rita by Giulio Campi (1547)
description: Campi's fresco shows Mary and Joseph presenting the infant Jesus to Simeon in the Temple, fulfilling Jewish purification rituals.
location: Chiesa di Santa Rita, Cremona, Italy
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of infant Jesus at the Temple
title: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple

caption: Finding of Jesus in the Temple mosaic from Lourdes Basilica, France
description: This mosaic depicts Mary and Joseph finding young Jesus discussing theology with Temple elders, showing his divine wisdom.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Twelve-year-old Jesus teaching in the Temple
title: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple

caption: An unknown artist’s fresco, Baptism of Christ, in Padua’s church of San Benedetto
description: This fresco depicts John the Baptist baptizing Jesus in the Jordan River, with the Holy Spirit descending as a dove.
location: Church of San Benedetto Vecchio, Padua, Italy
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus by John the Baptist
title: The Baptism of Christ

caption: Carl Bloch’s The Wedding at Cana
description: Bloch's painting shows Jesus performing his first miracle, transforming water into wine at a wedding celebration in Cana.
subject: Jesus turning water into wine at wedding feast
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: James Tissot’s Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum
description: Tissot's work depicts Jesus healing lepers while teaching about the Kingdom of God, showing his compassion and authority.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: Jesus healing lepers and proclaiming God's kingdom
title: Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum

caption: Transfiguration in Vienna’s Votive Church
description: This artwork depicts Jesus transfigured in divine light before Peter, James, and John, with Moses and Elijah appearing.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus before disciples
title: The Transfiguration

caption: Giacomo Raffaelli (1753-1836) , an Italian mosaicist, created a life-sized mosaic copy of Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper
description: Raffaelli's mosaic reproduces Leonardo's masterpiece showing Jesus instituting the Eucharist during his final meal with apostles.
subject: Institution of the Eucharist at Last Supper
title: The Last Supper

caption: Agony in the Garden by Vicente Masip, also known as Vicente Juan Masip
description: Christ kneels in prayer at Gethsemane while angels bring him the chalice of suffering. The apostles sleep in the foreground as Judas approaches with soldiers.
subject: Christ praying in Gethsemane with sleeping apostles
title: Agony in the Garden

caption: Giovanni Antonio Bazzi known as Sodoma, Christ at the Column (c. 1510-1515; detached fresco, 140 x 101 cm; Siena, Pinacoteca Nazionale)
description: Christ stands bound to a column, his body marked with wounds from the scourging. The composition emphasizes his patient suffering and divine acceptance of punishment.
subject: Christ bound to the column during his flagellation
title: Christ at the Column

caption: Titian's Christ Crowned with Thorns (c. 1542–1543)
description: Soldiers violently press the crown of thorns onto Christ's head as he endures the mockery with serene dignity. Dramatic lighting emphasizes his suffering.
subject: Roman soldiers pressing the crown of thorns onto Christ's head
title: Christ Crowned with Thorns

caption: Pieter Bruegel the Elder's The Procession to Calvary (1564)
description: Christ falls under the weight of the cross amidst a vast crowd. The painting contrasts his solitary suffering with the indifferent daily life continuing around him.
subject: Christ carrying the cross through a crowded landscape to Golgotha
title: The Procession to Calvary

caption: The fresco of Crucifixion in the church San Girolamo dei Croati by Pietro Gagliardi (1847-1852)
description: Christ hangs on the cross surrounded by the grieving Virgin Mary, John the Evangelist, and Mary Magdalene. The composition emphasizes the theological significance of the sacrifice.
subject: Christ crucified with Mary, John, and Mary Magdalene at the foot of the cross
title: Crucifixion

caption: Resurrection (1593) by Annibale Carracci
description: Christ emerges gloriously from the tomb, holding the banner of resurrection. Roman soldiers recoil in awe and fear at the miraculous event.
subject: Christ rising triumphantly from the tomb surrounded by astonished soldiers
title: Resurrection

caption: Crossing (Ascension) cupola 1175-1200 Mosaic Basilica di San Marco (Cupola of St. Mark), Venice
description: Christ rises to heaven in a mandorla of light, supported by angels. The Virgin Mary stands centrally below, surrounded by astonished apostles witnessing the event.
subject: Christ ascending into heaven surrounded by angels and the Virgin Mary
title: The Ascension

caption: “Pentecost” by Jean Restout II (1692–1768)
description: The Holy Spirit descends as tongues of fire upon the Virgin Mary and apostles gathered in the upper room. Dramatic lighting emphasizes the divine intervention.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: The descent of the Holy Spirit upon the Virgin Mary and apostles
title: Pentecost

caption: The Assumption of Virgin Mary in the main cupola in Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto by Giuseppe and Andrea Orazi 1706
description: The Virgin Mary rises to heaven surrounded by angels and putti. The composition creates a dynamic upward movement celebrating her glorious assumption.
location: Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto, Rome
subject: The Virgin Mary being assumed body and soul into heaven
title: The Assumption of the Virgin Mary

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, a painting on oil on canvas by Diego Velázquez of the Holy Trinity crowning the Blessed Virgin Mary, at the Museo del Prado
description: God the Father and Christ place a crown upon the Virgin Mary's head while the Holy Spirit hovers above. Angels witness her coronation as Queen of Heaven.
subject: The Holy Trinity crowning the Virgin Mary as Queen of Heaven
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: The Annunciation, an 1898 painting by African-American painter Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: A groundbreaking depiction of the Annunciation showing Mary as an ordinary young woman in a humble Middle Eastern setting, illuminated by divine light.
subject: Annunciation to the Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: The painting of Visitation in the church Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio by Federico Maldarelli (1889)
description: A traditional academic depiction of the meeting between Virgin Mary and her cousin Elizabeth, both pregnant with Jesus and John the Baptist.
location: Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio, Naples, Italy
subject: Visitation of Mary to Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Gerard van Honthorst - Adoration of the Shepherds (1622)
description: A dramatic Baroque night scene illuminated by divine light, showing shepherds worshiping the newborn Jesus in a humble stable setting.
subject: Nativity scene with shepherds adoring Christ child
title: Adoration of the Shepherds

caption: The painting of Presentation of Jesus in the Temple in church kostel Svatého Havla by unknown baroque artist
description: A Baroque depiction of Mary and Joseph presenting the infant Jesus to Simeon in the Temple, fulfilling Jewish purification laws.
location: Church of St. Gall (kostel Svatého Havla), Prague
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of infant Jesus in the Temple
title: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple

caption: Jesus, at 12, teaching in the Temple
description: Depiction of the young Jesus astonishing Temple scholars with his wisdom, showing his divine understanding even as a child.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Twelve-year-old Jesus teaching scholars in the Temple
title: Jesus Teaching in the Temple

artist: Andrea del Verrocchio and Leonardo da Vinci
caption: The Baptism of Christ by Leonardo Da Vinci created in the studio of Andrea del Verrochio around 1475
description: Collaborative work showing John baptizing Jesus in the Jordan River, with angels witnessing and the Holy Spirit descending as a dove.
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus by John the Baptist
title: The Baptism of Christ

caption: Gerard David's The Marriage at Cana
description: A detailed Early Netherlandish depiction of the wedding feast where Jesus transforms water into wine, his first public miracle.
subject: Wedding at Cana where Jesus performs his first miracle
title: The Marriage at Cana

caption: The Adulterous Woman by Lorenzo Lotto
description: A dramatic Renaissance scene showing Jesus protecting a woman from stoning, illustrating his mercy and the proclamation of forgiveness.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: Jesus saving the adulterous woman from stoning
title: Christ and the Adulteress

caption: Raphael's The Transfiguration
description: Raphael's masterpiece combining the Transfiguration of Christ with the healing of a possessed boy, showing divine glory and human need.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus on Mount Tabor
title: The Transfiguration

caption: The Last Supper by Juan de Juanes
description: A Spanish Renaissance depiction of the Last Supper emphasizing the institution of the Eucharist with Christ offering the consecrated host.
subject: Institution of the Eucharist at the Last Supper
title: The Last Supper

caption: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane by Alessandro Maganza
description: Depicts Jesus praying in anguish while disciples sleep, capturing the moment of spiritual struggle before His Passion.
original_title: L'Orazione di Gesù nell'Orto del Getsemani
subject: Christ's agony in the Garden of Gethsemane
title: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane

caption: The Flagellation of Christ: Painting by Caravaggio
description: Dramatic Baroque depiction of Christ bound to a column while Roman soldiers whip Him, emphasizing human suffering.
subject: Christ being scourged at the pillar
title: The Flagellation of Christ

caption: Caravaggio's Ecce Homo - Behold The Man
description: Shows Christ crowned with thorns presented by Pilate who declares 'Behold the Man' to the mocking crowd.
subject: Pontius Pilate presenting Christ to the crowd
title: Ecce Homo

caption: The Lost Caravaggio - Ecce Homo
description: Recently rediscovered work showing the suffering Christ with crown of thorns, possibly by Caravaggio.
subject: Christ presented to the people after being mocked
title: Ecce Homo

caption: Christ carrying the Cross (1605) by Orazio Gentileschi
description: Depicts the exhausted Christ struggling under the weight of the cross on the road to Golgotha.
subject: Christ carrying His cross to Calvary
title: Christ Carrying the Cross

caption: James Tissot's What Our Lord Saw From The Cross
description: Unique perspective showing the crowd below from Christ's viewpoint during the Crucifixion.
original_title: Ce que voyait Notre-Seigneur sur la Croix
subject: The view from Christ's perspective on the cross
title: What Our Lord Saw from the Cross

caption: Caravaggio's The Incredulity of St. Thomas
description: Shows the apostle Thomas physically verifying Christ's resurrection by touching His wounds.
subject: Thomas touching Christ's wounds after Resurrection
title: The Incredulity of Saint Thomas

caption: Ascension of the Lord by Bernardino Gandino
description: Depicts the risen Christ ascending bodily into heaven while apostles watch in wonder below.
subject: Christ ascending into heaven
title: Ascension of the Lord

caption: Pentecost by Titian
description: Shows the Holy Spirit descending as tongues of fire upon the Virgin Mary and apostles at Pentecost.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: Descent of the Holy Spirit upon the apostles
title: Pentecost

caption: Fresco of Assumption of Our Lady in the Vision of St Bonaventure in the church Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone by Cesare Mariani (1863)
description: Fresco depicting the Virgin Mary's bodily assumption into heaven as witnessed by St. Bonaventure.
location: Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone, Rome
original_title: Assunzione della Vergine con Visione di San Bonaventura
subject: Virgin Mary's assumption into heaven
title: Assumption of the Virgin with Vision of St. Bonaventure

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, fresco by Giuseppe Mattia Borgnis
description: Baroque fresco depicting Mary being crowned by the Holy Trinity as Queen of Heaven, symbolizing her special role in salvation history.
subject: Coronation of Mary as Queen of Heaven
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: Jan van Eyck's The Annunciation portrays the angel Gabriel announcing to Mary, who humbly accepts God's will
description: Northern Renaissance masterpiece showing Archangel Gabriel announcing to Mary that she will bear the Son of God, with rich symbolic details.
location: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.
subject: Annunciation to the Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: Basilica of the Visitation in Ein Karem, a village in the hill country of Judea where John the Baptist was born
description: Artwork depicting Mary's visit to her cousin Elizabeth, both pregnant with Jesus and John the Baptist, showing mutual recognition of God's work.
location: Basilica of the Visitation, Ein Karem
subject: Mary visiting Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence by Caravaggio
description: Caravaggio's dramatic Baroque depiction of Christ's birth with saints Francis and Lawrence, known for its chiaroscuro and emotional intensity.
original_title: Natività con i Santi Francesco e Lorenzo
subject: Nativity of Jesus with saints
title: Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence

caption: Simeon's Song of Praise by Arent de Gelder
description: Dutch Golden Age painting showing Simeon recognizing the infant Jesus as the Messiah during presentation in the Temple.
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
title: Simeon's Song of Praise

caption: Finding of the Savior in the Temple by William Holman Hunt
description: Pre-Raphaelite masterpiece depicting twelve-year-old Jesus discussing with rabbis in the Temple, discovered by his worried parents.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
original_title: The Finding of the Saviour in the Temple
subject: Finding of Jesus in the Temple
title: The Finding of the Saviour in the Temple

caption: Apparition of the Messiah, an oil painting on canvas, measuring 540 cm × 750 cm, by Russian painter Alexander Andreyevich Ivanov (1806–1858)
description: Monumental Russian Romantic painting showing John the Baptist pointing to the approaching Christ, with diverse reactions from the crowd.
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Christ's appearance to the people
title: Apparition of the Messiah

caption: Wedding at Cana by Paolo Veronese
description: Massive Venetian Renaissance painting depicting Christ's first miracle of turning water into wine at a wedding feast.
subject: Wedding at Cana miracle
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: Christ in the Storm on the Sea of Galilee, a 1633 oil-on-canvas painting by the Dutch Golden Age painter Rembrandt van Rijn
description: Rembrandt's dramatic seascape showing Jesus calming the storm while disciples panic, demonstrating his divine authority over nature.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
original_title: Christus in de storm op het meer van Galilea
subject: Christ calming the storm
title: Christ in the Storm on the Sea of Galilee

caption: The Savior's Transfiguration by Theophanes the Greek
description: Byzantine fresco showing Christ transfigured in divine light with Moses and Elijah, witnessed by Peter, James, and John.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus
title: The Transfiguration

caption: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper by Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: Tanner's intimate depiction of Christ preparing for the Last Supper, showing spiritual preparation before the institution of the Eucharist.
subject: Christ preparing for the Last Supper with disciples
title: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper

caption: The Arrest of Christ Kiss of Judas by Giotto
description: Giotto's dramatic fresco showing Judas's betrayal with a kiss, capturing the moment of Christ's arrest with emotional intensity.
subject: Judas betraying Christ with a kiss in Gethsemane
title: The Arrest of Christ (Kiss of Judas)

caption: The Flagellation of Our Lord Jesus Christ by Bouguereau
description: Bouguereau's academic masterpiece depicting Christ's brutal scourging, emphasizing his suffering and divine resignation.
subject: Christ being scourged at the pillar
title: The Flagellation of Our Lord Jesus Christ

caption: Van Dyck's _The Crowning with Thorns_ (early 17th century), a Baroque depiction of Christ's suffering and paradoxical triumph
description: Van Dyck's Baroque interpretation of Christ's humiliation, showing the crown of thorns as both torture and paradoxical kingship.
subject: Roman soldiers mocking Christ with crown of thorns
title: The Crowning with Thorns

caption: Raphael's Christ Falls on the Way to Calvary, a painting depicting Christ stumbling under the cross with Mary and a crowd witnessing
description: Raphael's dramatic depiction of Christ's third fall, showing his humanity and suffering while carrying the cross to Calvary.
subject: Christ falling under the weight of the cross on Via Dolorosa
title: Christ Falls on the Way to Calvary

caption: The Descent from the Cross (1616-1617) by Rubens: A dynamic, dramatic depiction of Christ's descent
description: Rubens' Baroque masterpiece showing the emotional descent of Christ's body from the cross, emphasizing his sacrifice and humanity.
subject: Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus lowering Christ's body from the cross
title: The Descent from the Cross

caption: The Three Marys at the Tomb by Annibale Carracci, 17th century at Hermitage Museum, reveals Baroque vividness and drama
description: Carracci's Baroque depiction of the holy women discovering Christ's empty tomb, capturing their astonishment at the Resurrection.
location: State Hermitage Museum, St. Petersburg, Russia
subject: The three Marys discovering the empty tomb of Christ
title: The Three Marys at the Tomb

caption: Christ Taking Leave of the Apostles by Duccio, 14th century, Museo dell'Opera, tempera on wood, Gothic details
description: Duccio's Gothic panel showing Christ's post-resurrection appearance and final instructions to apostles before his Ascension.
location: Museo dell'Opera del Duomo, Siena, Italy
subject: Christ's final appearance and commissioning of apostles before Ascension
title: Christ Taking Leave of the Apostles

caption: Simone Peterzano's Pentecost depicts the Virgin and disciples receiving the Holy Spirit in Mannerist style
description: Peterzano's Mannerist interpretation of Pentecost, showing the Holy Spirit descending as tongues of fire upon the gathered disciples.
location: Church of San Fedele, Milan, Italy
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: The descent of the Holy Spirit upon the apostles and Mary
title: Pentecost

caption: The Divine Exchange Between Mother and Son
description: Gothic stained glass window depicting Mary's assumption into heaven, surrounded by angels and welcomed by Christ.
subject: The Virgin Mary being assumed body and soul into heaven
title: The Assumption of Mary

caption: Mary, Help of Christians by Giuseppe Rollini
description: A fresco depicting the Virgin Mary as Help of Christians, showing her maternal protection and intercessory role for the faithful, rendered in traditional Catholic iconography.
subject: Virgin Mary as protector and intercessor for Christians
title: Mary, Help of Christians
